rnalysis.filtering.DESeqFilter.features_string¶

DESeqFilter.features_string() → str¶

Returns a string of all WBGene indices in the current DataFrame separated by newline (the WBGene indices which were not filtered out by previously-used filter methods). Warning: if any duplicate features exist in the filter object (same WBGene appears more than once), the corresponding WBGene index will appear in the returned string ONLY ONCE.

return

A string of WBGene indices separated by newlines (

). For example, “WBGene00000001 WBGene00000003 WBGene12345678”.
